intro: Teline atleyana, commonly known as the narrow-leaved teline, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinctive, finely divided appearance, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. Teline atleyana is also noted for its medicinal properties, with historical use in traditional herbal remedies.
